name: biomni-analyze-fda-safety-signals
title: Biomni: Analyze Fda Safety Signals
description: Analyzes FDA safety signals for drugs using pharmacovigilance data
content:
Overview

Analyzes FDA safety signals for drugs using pharmacovigilance data from the FAERS database. This tool identifies disproportionate adverse event reporting patterns that may indicate safety concerns requiring further investigation.

Input Parameters

  • drug_list (required): List of drug names to analyze for safety signals
  • comparison_period (optional): Tuple or list of two dates defining the analysis period (e.g., ["2020-01-01", "2023-12-31"])
  • signal_threshold (optional): Statistical threshold for signal detection (default: 2.0)

Input Format

{
  "drug_list": ["Aspirin", "Ibuprofen"],
  "comparison_period": ["2020-01-01", "2023-12-31"],
  "signal_threshold": 2.0
}

Biological Use Case

Essential for post-market drug safety surveillance and pharmacovigilance. Helps identify emerging safety concerns, supports regulatory decision-making, and enables proactive risk management for marketed pharmaceuticals.

Output

Safety signal analysis results including disproportionality metrics, identified signals, and statistical significance saved to safety_signals_results.txt

Category

pharmacology
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python3 prod_apps/biomni/pharmacology/analyze_fda_safety_signals.py --drug-list "${drugList}" ${comparisonPeriod:+--comparison-period "${comparisonPeriod}"} --signal-threshold "${signalThreshold}" -o "${outputDir}"
